Redam Polemik, Nasdem DKI Minta Anies Buka Data Anggaran
01 Nov 2019, 01:13 by Bisnis.com, Martha Warta Silaban
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta -Ketua Fraksi Nasdem Wibi Andrino meminta Gubernur DKI Jakarta Anies Baswedan membuka data anggaran kepada masyarakat. Menurutnya proses keterbukaan informasi kepada publik dapat meredam polemik tentang isi Kebijakan Umum APBD Plafon Prioritas Anggaran Sementara atau KUA-PPAS 2020.
"Komponennya [KUA-PPAS] dibuka saja karena ini sudah era keterbukaan. Sekarang ini masyarakat pintar dan kritis. Bilamana tidak [dibuka] akan jadi pertanyaan ada apa dibalik ini?" kata Wibi, Kamis, 31 Oktober 2019.
Dia menuturkan Fraksi Nasdem DKI Jakarta meminta Anies untuk membuka anggaran tersebut. Namun, permintaan itu belum terealisasi hingga kini.
Meski demikian, Wibi mengaku pernah bertanya kepada Kementerian Dalam Negeri soal konsep keterbukaan anggaran. Menurut Kemendagri, katanya, keterbukaan data anggaran saat ini belum final menjadi hak dari masing-masing daerah.
"Saya sempat bertanya ke staf Kemendagri waktu Bimtek di Bandung. Apakah ada kewajiban mempublikasikan rancangan KUA-PPAS? Dia menjelaskan tidak ada kewajiban, tidak ada paksaan. Namun, ketika rapat wajib dibuka," imbuhnya.
Dia mengingatkan Anies bahwa Jakarta bukan cuma milik penduduk yang tinggal dan mencari nafkah di Jakarta, tetapi menjadi sorotan dan acuan atau role model seluruh rakyat Indonesia.
Menurutnya, fraksi Nasdem DKI siap membahas anggaran secara detail hingga tuntas dengan satuan kerja perangkat daerah (SKPD) DKI.
Dia juga meminta agar semua pihak tak meragukan kualitas anggaran di tengah waktu yang mepet. Nasdem DKI siap untuk membahas anggaran secara detail. Wibi mengatakan fraksinya juga siap menanggung akibat jika nantinya ada keterlambatan pencairan anggaran
"Buka saja semua data anggaran seterang-terangnya agar tidak jadi preseden buruk. Lagi pula, kami kerja sesuai aturan enggak jadi soal, asal anggaran satu per satu detail kita sisir sampai selesai," ucapnya.

Reducing Polemic, DKI Nasdem Asks Anies to Open Budget Data
01 Nov 2019, 01:13 by Bisnis.com, Martha Warta Silaban
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Chairman of Nasdem Faction Wibi Andrino asked DKI Jakarta Governor Anies Baswedan to open budget data to the public. According to him, the process of disclosure of information to the public could reduce the polemic regarding the content of the Provisional Budget Ceiling of the Provisional Budget Ceiling or KUA-PPAS 2020.
"The components of [KUA-PPAS] are just opened because this is an era of openness. Now this community is smart and critical. If it is not [opened] it will be a question what's behind this?" said Wibi, Thursday, October 31, 2019.
He said the DKI Jakarta Nasdem Faction asked Anies to open the budget. However, the request has not been realized until now.
However, Wibi claimed to have asked the Ministry of the Interior about the concept of budget transparency. According to the Ministry of Home Affairs, he said, the disclosure of current budget data is not yet final to the rights of each region.
"I had asked the Ministry of Home Affairs staff when the Technical Guidance was in Bandung. Was there an obligation to publish the KUA-PPAS draft? He explained that there was no obligation, no coercion. However, when the meeting was required to open," he added.
He reminded Anies that Jakarta was not only the property of residents who lived and made a living in Jakarta, but became the spotlight and reference or role model for all Indonesian people.
According to him, the DKI Nasdem faction is ready to discuss the budget in detail until it is complete with the regional work unit (SKPD) of DKI.
He also requested that all parties not doubt the quality of the budget in the middle of a tight time. Nasdem DKI is ready to discuss the budget in detail. Wibi said that her faction was also ready to bear the consequences if there would be a delay in disbursing the budget
"Just open all the budget data as brightly as possible so that it does not become a bad precedent. After all, we work according to the rules, it doesn't matter, as long as we comb through the budget one by one," he said.
